metadata.dc:author: Katai, H
Ríos, P
Maruyama, K
Sasako, M
Sano, T
metadata.dc:description: At the National Cancer Center of Tokyo Gastric Division, from 13/09/1993 to 12/11/93, 42 gastrectomies, 3 local resections and 1 exploratory laparotomy, for gastric cancer, were carried out. Resection R2 were carried out in 29/42 (69%), resection R2 plus dissection of the station 16 in 5/42 (12%), resection R3 plus dissection of the station 16 in 4/42 (9.5%) and distal pancreas preserving in 11/14 (78.6%) of the total gastrectomies. The most frequently type of reconstruction done after distal gastrectomy was Billroth 1 in 20/28 (71.4%) and the most frequent stage of the disease was la-b in 34/46 (74%). Postoperative severe complications were present in 5/42 (12%) and the most frequently histological type was tubular adenocarcinoma 27/46 (58.7%).
metadata.dc:title: Situación actual y estrategia en el tratamiento del cáncer gástrico en el National Cancer Center de Tokyo-Japon.
[The current situation and treatment strategy for gastric cancer at the National Cancer Center of Tokyo, Japan].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista de gastroenterologia del Peru : organo oficial de la Sociedad de Gastroenterologia del Peru
